010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
016
017/**
018 * Vector version (applicable to ColorProcessor only).
019 * This class implements a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter suggested in 
020 * Tomita and Tsuji (1977). It structures the filter region into five overlapping, 
021 * square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). 
022 * See algorithm 5.2 in Utics Vol. 3.
023 * 
024 * @author W. Burger
025 * @version 2021/01/02
026 */
027public class KuwaharaFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements KuwaharaF {
028        
029        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
030        private final int dm;                   // = d-
031        private final int dp;                   // = d+
032        private final float tsigma;
033
034        // constructor using default settings
035        public KuwaharaFilterVector() {
036                this(new Parameters());
037        }
038        
039        public KuwaharaFilterVector(Parameters params) {
040                int r = params.radius;
041                this.n = sqr(r + 1);    // size of complete filter
042                this.dm = (r / 2) - r;                  // d- = top/left center coordinate
043                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
044                this.tsigma = (float)params.tsigma;
045        }
046        
047        // ------------------------------------------------------
048
049        private float Smin;             // min. variance
050        private final float[] Amin = new float[3];
051        private final float[] rgb = new float[3];
052        
053
054        @Override
055        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v)  {
056                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
057                evalSubregion(pack, u, v);                              // centered subregion - different to original Kuwahara!
058                Smin = Smin - 3 * tsigma * n;                           // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
059                evalSubregion(pack, u + dm, v + dm);
060                evalSubregion(pack, u + dm, v + dp);
061                evalSubregion(pack, u + dp, v + dm);
062                evalSubregion(pack, u + dp, v + dp);
063                this.copyPixel(Amin, rgb);
064                return rgb;
065        } 
066        
067        private void evalSubregion(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
068                // evaluate the subregion centered at (u,v)
069                final float[] S1 = new float[3];        // sum of pixel values
070                final float[] S2 = new float[3];        // sum of squared pixel values
071                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
072                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {                
073                                float[] cp = source.getVec(u + i, v + j);
074
075                                S1[0] = S1[0] + cp[0];
076                                S1[1] = S1[1] + cp[1];
077                                S1[2] = S1[2] + cp[2];
078                                
079                                S2[0] = S2[0] + sqr(cp[0]);
080                                S2[1] = S2[1] + sqr(cp[1]);
081                                S2[2] = S2[2] + sqr(cp[2]);
082                        }
083                }
084                // calculate the variance for this subregion:
085//              S[0] = S2[0] - S1[0] * S1[0] / n;
086//              S[1] = S2[1] - S1[1] * S1[1] / n;
087//              S[2] = S2[2] - S1[2] * S1[2] / n;
088                // total variance (scaled by n):
089//              float Srgb = S[0] + S[1] + S[2];
090                float Srgb = (S2[0] - sqr(S1[0]) + S2[1] - sqr(S1[1]) + S2[2] - sqr(S1[2])) / n;
091                if (Srgb < Smin) { 
092                        Smin = Srgb;
093                        Amin[0] = S1[0] / n;
094                        Amin[1] = S1[1] / n;
095                        Amin[2] = S1[2] / n;
096                }
097        }
098
099}
